de.lmu.ifi.mfa

Class FlowNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • de.lmu.ifi.mfa.FlowNetwork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFlowNetwork, java.io.Serializable

    public class FlowNetwork
extends java.util.Observable
implements IFlowNetwork, java.io.Serializable
    The FlowNetwork class is an implementation a flow network interface IFlowNetwork. It supports the following two primary functionalities: create and manipulate a flow network, evaluate the maximum flow on the network.

    The whole functionality is based only on non-negative integer values as identifiers. The internal data structure uses protected classes to represent a graph, vertex, or edge.

    The class implements methods to add and remove vertices or edges as well as methods to set source and sink vertex. It contains two methods that implement Dinic's and Goldberg-Tarjan's maximum flow algorithms to compute the maximum flow in O(n²m) and O(n³) time, respectively.

    Additionally, there are methods to save and load the flow network. Furthermore, the interface provides methods to query data about the current state of the flow network in order to connect a graphical user interface.

    For additional information, see MFA project by Christian Gebhardt on Github.

    Since:
    2016-09-03
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Christian Gebhardt
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlowNetwork

        public FlowNetwork()
        The constructor creates an empty flow network. Therefore, it creates an empty directed graph as internal data structure and it assigns default values to all variables.

      • removeVertex

        public void removeVertex(int vertexId)
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Remove a vertex from the graph of the flow network. When the vertex has incoming and outgoing edges, all the adjacent edges are also removed.
        Specified by:
        removeVertex in interface IFlowNetwork
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier. It has to be non-negative integer that exists in the graph, otherwise it shows a failure message.

      • removeVertex

                         boolean draw)

        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier. It has to be non-negative integer that exists in the graph, otherwise it shows a failure message.
        draw - flag to update and redraw the graph.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(int vertexId1,
                    int vertexId2,
                    int capacity)
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Add an edge to the graph of the flow network. When the edge already exists, nothing happens.
        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface IFlowNetwork
        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        capacity - the maximum flow capacity of the edge. It has to be a positive integer, otherwise it shows a failure message.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(int vertexId1,
                    int vertexId2,
                    int capacity,
                    boolean draw)
        Add an edge to the graph of the flow network. When the edge already exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        capacity - the maximum flow capacity of the edge. It has to be a positive integer, otherwise it shows a failure message.
        draw - flag to update and redraw the graph.

        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge.

      • dinic

        public int dinic()
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Calculate and return the maximum flow with Dinic's augmenting path algorithm. This method calculates one solution for the maximum flow in O(n²m) time and updates the flow in the network to this maximum flow.
        Specified by:
        dinic in interface IFlowNetwork
        Returns:
        the maximum flow of the flow network.

      • goldbergTarjan

        public int goldbergTarjan()
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Calculate and return the maximum flow with Goldberg-Tarjan's push-relabel algorithm. This method calculates one solution for the maximum flow in O(n³) time and updates the flow in the network to this maximum flow.
        Specified by:
        goldbergTarjan in interface IFlowNetwork
        Returns:
        the maximum flow of the flow network.

      • resetNetwork

        public void resetNetwork()
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Reset the flow network to an empty network.This method removes all edges and vertices from the graph to reset the flow network to the initial state.
        Specified by:
        resetNetwork in interface IFlowNetwork

      • loadNetwork

        public void loadNetwork(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Load a flow network from a file. This method load a previously saved flow network with the current state of the flow from a special *.mfa file. When the file is not found, or another failure arises, nothing happens.
        Specified by:
        loadNetwork in interface IFlowNetwork
        Parameters:
        file - the file to load the flow network.
        See Also:
        File

      • saveNetwork

        public void saveNetwork(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Save the flow network to a file. This method saves the total topology of the flow network with the current state of the flow to the file system. Therefore, it uses a special file format *.mfa. When a failure arises, nothing happens.
        Specified by:
        saveNetwork in interface IFlowNetwork
        Parameters:
        file - the file to save the flow network.
        See Also:
        File

      • displayFlowNetwork

        public java.lang.String displayFlowNetwork()
        Description copied from interface: IFlowNetwork
        Return a String with the current state of the flow network. This method can be used to display the flow network in text format. It contains the source and sink vertex identifiers the maximum flow and a list of all vertices with their adjacent lists of edges.
        Specified by:
        displayFlowNetwork in interface IFlowNetwork
        Returns:
        current state of the flow network in text format.
